title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Gowrie House, the scene of the mysterious incident in Scottish history called the Gowrie Conspiracy (a.d. 1600 — James VI.) stood at the south end of the Watergate. The whole of that interesting old building was vmfortunately taken down in 1807, and the site isnow occupied by the County Buildings  and Jail. At the end of George Street is a stone building, erected in 1823 in honour of Provost Marshall.
